comments: Eclipse just hangs ocasinally with a 50% CPU consumption. Hard to reproduce though, but its something you should keep an eye on, maybe others reported it too - so you could perhaps find a common denominator. I got it when I did a Source -> Externalize Strings, and once when I ran Middlegen wizzard. The common factor in both was that the operation (externalize or middlegen final step in the wizzard) that it was run second time in a lifetime of a running eclipse instance. First time didnt do it.

What VM do you use?  Is your machine a dual processor?

If you are using a Sun VM then try the vm option -XX:MaxPermSize=128M

This may be a dup of bug 153485.

Environment as follows:

Dual Processor
Arch x86
OS Windows XP 5.1
java version "1.5.0_07"

C:\eclipse\3.2\eclipse.exe  -jvmargs -server -Xms1024M -Xmx1024M -refresh

Still same problem with eclipse 3.2.1. It just hangs with 50% CPU (which I am translating to 100%CPU actually on one of the 2 dual core units).
I couldnt tell what exactly is causing it but it sure does it often.

start with -console then hit ctrl-break in the command prompt when it appears to hang.  Attach the resultant stack trace here.  For fun you might do a few of them and compare yourself to see if they are basically the same.

Thanks for the reply. I started it as you asked me to. I just got it hanging again 50% CPU flat out. But nothing happens when trying to stop it (CTRL-C).
Cheers
you appear to be on Windows.  Ctrl-Break is not Ctrl-C.  The "Break" key is typcially on the top right of your keyboard and often also has "Pause" on it.  Try it, you'll like it :-)

Sorry, I wasn't paying attention. I got it reproduced again. Here is the stacktrace from Ctrl-Break:

This is a duplicate of the Sun VM bug.  The defining characteristic is that there is one thread blocked inside a class load call, and CPU usage is maxed out (or 50% on a dual processor).

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 153485 ***

The stack traces in comment #14 are not a deadlock - they are NPEs in apache code. The deadlock is covered by bug 153485.
